designScenario.name: Pressurization System
designScenario.description: The Pressurization System maintains safe and comfortable cabin pressure levels by regulating airflow and pressure differentials during all flight phases. It dynamically adjusts cabin altitude to simulate near-sea-level conditions (typically ≤8,000 ft) despite external atmospheric changes. The system integrates with the Environmental Control System (ECS) to manage outflow valves, monitor pressure sensors, and activate safety mechanisms during rapid decompression events. It ensures structural integrity of the airframe while prioritizing passenger comfort and compliance with aviation safety regulations.

details.description: Automatically maintain cabin pressure between 0.8 atm and 1.2 atm using closed-loop control of outflow valves and air supply inputs.
Limit cabin altitude change rates to ≤500 ft/min during ascent/descent to prevent passenger discomfort.
Implement redundant pressure relief valves to prevent cabin-to-external pressure differentials exceeding 9.0 psi (airframe limit).
Detect rapid decompression events and initiate corrective actions (oxygen mask deployment, emergency descent) within 2 seconds.
Provide triple-redundant pressure sensor arrays with voting logic to prevent single-point failures.
Include built-in test equipment (BITE) for valve actuation tests and leak rate calculations during ground maintenance.

systemComponents.name: Pressure Control Unit
systemComponents.description: Central controller processing sensor data and executing pressurization schedules via PID algorithms.

subComponents.name: Flight Phase Scheduler
subComponents.description: Generates target pressure schedules based on aircraft altitude and flight phase (climb, cruise, descent).

subComponents.name: Valve Actuator Controller
subComponents.description: Converts pressure error signals into precise valve position commands.

systemComponents.name: Outflow Valve Assembly
systemComponents.description: Electro-mechanically actuated valve modulating cabin exhaust airflow to control pressure.

subComponents.name: Valve Actuator
subComponents.description: Electric motor or pneumatic actuator providing torque for valve positioning.

subComponents.name: Valve Position Sensor
subComponents.description: LVDT or rotary encoder providing real-time valve angle feedback.

systemComponents.name: Cabin Pressure Sensors
systemComponents.description: Redundant absolute pressure transducers measuring cabin altitude equivalent pressure.

subComponents.name: Primary Pressure Transducer
subComponents.description: High-accuracy piezoresistive sensor with temperature compensation.

subComponents.name: Backup Capacitive Sensor
subComponents.description: Secondary measurement using diaphragm capacitance technique.

systemComponents.name: Safety Relief Valves
systemComponents.description: Passive mechanical valves opening automatically at preset differential pressures.

systemComponents.name: Air Supply Duct
systemComponents.description: Bleed air conduit delivering compressed air from engines/APU for pressurization.

relationships.description: Control unit aggregates data from all cabin pressure sensors for differential voting
Valve positioning commands from control unit directly drive actuator movements
Safety valves are physically integrated into outflow valve housing as fail-safe mechanism
Control unit monitors bleed air supply pressure via dedicated transducers in duct
Integrated with ECS for coordinated temperature/pressure management through shared data bus

attributes.name: pressureRange
attributes.description: Operational cabin pressure range simulating ≤8,000 ft equivalent altitude

attributes.name: responseTime
attributes.description: Maximum allowed latency between pressure deviation detection and control surface adjustment

attributes.name: valveActuationTime
attributes.description: Outflow valve actuation speed range from closed to fully open positions

attributes.name: sensorAccuracy
attributes.description: Maximum permissible error in pressure transducers across operating envelope

attributes.name: redundancyLevel
attributes.description: Architecture ensuring continued operation with two concurrent sensor failures

attributes.name: maxPressureDifferential
attributes.description: Absolute maximum pressure difference between cabin and external environment before safety valve actuation

comments.body: Maintains cabin altitude ≤ 8,000ft during normal operation
